required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CAR-T Cells in the Treatment of Malignant Hematological Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Study of CAR-T Technique in the Treatment of Recurrent and Refractory Hematopoietic and Lymphatic Tumor

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the safety of autologous CAR-T cell injection in the treatment of recurrent and refractory hematopoietic and lymphoid tissue tumors

detailed_description.textblock: Main research objective: To evaluate the safety of autologous CAR-T cell injection in the treatment of recurrent and refractory hematopoietic and lymphoid tissue tumors. Secondary research objective: To investigate the efficacy and cytodynamic characteristics of autologous CAR-T cell injection in the treatment of recurrent and refractory hematopoietic and lymphoid tissue tumors

primary_outcome.measure: Safety: Incidence and severity of adverse events
primary_outcome.description: The incidence and severity of adverse events and adverse reactions from infusion to withdrawal or before the safety follow-up period

arm_group.description: Autologous CAR-T cells, intravenous infusion, infusion dose 0.1-3 Ã— 106CAR-T cells/kg
